body_html:
@kevinashaw For the record, I found this gist to be helpful. He also has a blog where he talks about some of the undocumented features of an older version of TensorFlow. You still have to change out tf.nn.rnn_cell for tf.contrib.rnn, but this helped me get something going.

That said, I am now having an issue where my network is not updating at all. I train it for several epochs and get the exact same results every time.
body_text:
@kevinashaw For the record, I found this gist to be helpful. He also has a blog where he talks about some of the undocumented features of an older version of TensorFlow. You still have to change out tf.nn.rnn_cell for tf.contrib.rnn, but this helped me get something going.
That said, I am now having an issue where my network is not updating at all. I train it for several epochs and get the exact same results every time.
body:
@kevinashaw For the record, I found [this gist][1] to be helpful. He also has [a blog][2] where he talks about some of the undocumented features of an older version of TensorFlow. You still have to change out `tf.nn.rnn_cell` for `tf.contrib.rnn`, but this helped me get something going.

That said, I am now having an issue where my network is not updating at all. I train it for several epochs and get the exact same results every time.

[1]: https://gist.github.com/danijar/61f9226f7ea498abce36187ddaf51ed5
[2]: http://www.wildml.com/2016/08/rnns-in-tensorflow-a-practical-guide-and-undocumented-features/
